caption:
This photograph showcases a close-up portrait of an elderly man with a cheerful expression. He is wearing black-rimmed glasses and has short, combed, gray hair. His attire includes a dark blue suit, a light-colored shirt, and a patterned tie. The lighting highlights the textures of his skin and the glint of his glasses.

The background, although blurred, hints at an urban environment with portions of signage visible, including letters that suggest commercial settings. The combination of focused foreground and diffuse background accentuates the subjectâ€™s facial features and expression, adding depth to the portrait. The overall composition and the man's affable expression convey a sense of warmth and approachability.
title: Congressman Joe Skubitz, ranking minority member of the U.S. House Interior Committee, rides in the annual parade in Cottonwood Falls, Kansas, near Emporia. It is a part of the festivities of the Flint Hills Rodeo, a major cultural event of the area. Groups who want to see a Tallgrass Prairie National Park in their state allege the Kansas 5th District Congressman has kept such a bill bottled up in committee since 1971.
